Creating the Future We Want

 

 Holistic Solutions to Planetary Challenges

 

with

Rancher and Restoration Ecologist

 

:: :: ::

 

Free and open to the public.

 

(Please check the time as I believe there are other activities and lectures going on as part of this conference. Thanks. - S.)

Register HERE.

:: :: ::

 

Allan Savory is the Founder of the Savory Institute and originator of the Holistic Management approach to restoring grasslands, winner of the Buckminster Fuller Challenge Award, and finalist in the Virgin Earth Challenge

This is A two-day conference and hands-on workshop on creating policy in balance with nature using the Holistic Management approach developed by Savory, with case studies on the restoration of grasslands and with application to biodiversity enhancement, climate change mitigation, reversal of desertification, improvement of fisheries and forests, and equitable development and livelihood for people.

:: :: ::

Jan 25, 2013

Friday, January 25, 2013 - 2-4pm

Tufts University

ASEAN Auditorium The Fletcher School

160 Packard Avenue, Medford

 

:: :: ::

Contact Name: Miranda Fasulo - Miranda.Fasulo@tufts.edu

Convened by the Agriculture, Forests, and Biodiversity Program of the Center for International Environment and Resource Policy at Fletcher; the Agriculture, Food, and Environment Program of Tufts' Friedman School of Nutrition Science and Policy; and Planet-TECH Associates.

Allan Savory, pragmatic  practitioner and intellectual entrepreneur, has been developing and demonstrating a powerful technique that can reduce carbon dioxide in the atmosphere immediately while reversing desertification and providing livelihoods and food for millions of people. His applied research based in Zimbabwe on the restoration of grasslands has now  been replicated on millions of acres worldwide. The application of his methods has the potential to significantly reduce atmospheric carbon through an increase in plant growth and soil formation. This process begins immediately and involves no new technologies, only a shift to the Holistic Management practices for livestock that he has pioneered. Major organizations and institutions are now recognizing his work, but climate scientists and governments have yet to incorporate it into their analyses and policy prescriptions.


First in a Series of "Creating the Future We Want" Events.
